column4: What would cause me to not have sudo access on a fresh server install? that can't be default.. otherwise I'd be unable to do anything?
is your user member of the admin group?
let's just verify that: run 'groups' and see if 'admin' is listed
to fix this, you can reboot in recovery mode (grub menu option) and run 'adduser username admin'
did you only create the one user during install?
no, once will fix it.
after that, you'll be able to use sudo
no, somehow you've created a non-default install in that respect.
odder things have been known to happen.
no, normally it sets up one user and adds that to the admin group automatically
is Windows MR any better in that respect?
indeed, I mean ME ;)
okay, I'll keep it in mind (got an old ME laptop that I sometimes use for serial devices)
installing the server again and i dont think it's going to give me admin privileges, this isn uts
what's your install source? Ubuntu Server CD?
I'll quickly check launchpad for reports...
it's been reported: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debian-installer/+bug/158952  -- could you please add a comment confirming it?
great, thank you
did you test the workaround I suggested?
the report mentions fixing /etc/sudoers, which shouldn't be necessary IMO
i'm now trying to recover and i think i may have been wrong
i'm reading the group file and it shows adm: redone
no, adm != admin
